subject: Technology
title: Bots and Troll Farms
description: A micro-lesson that makes Bots and Troll Farms usable.

hook.text: During the 2016 US election, a building in St. Petersburg, Russia employed hundreds of people to post as fake Americans.

buildup.text: The Internet Research Agency created thousands of fake social media accounts that posed as American activists on both sides.

discovery.text: These accounts organized real protests, created viral memes, and amplified division on race, religion, and politics.

twist.text: The operation cost a few million dollars but reached over 150 million Americans. No weapon offers that reach for that price.

climax.text: Troll farms now operate from multiple countries. Foreign manipulation of domestic politics via social media is the new normal.

punchline.text: The cheapest weapon in modern warfare is a social media account.

quiz.question: How many Americans did the Russian troll operation reportedly reach?
